meanings.definition: A person or thing that wrings, such as a machine or tool.
meanings.sent1: The old washing machine had powerful wringers that squeezed out excess water from clothes.
meanings.sent2: She used the wringers on the mop bucket to remove the dirty water efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got its tail stuck in the wringers of the antique laundry press.
meanings.sent4: The wringers of time squeezed every drop of energy from the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The wringers on the lemon squeezer made juicing fruits a breeze.

meanings.definition: A difficult or demanding situation or task that causes stress or pressure.
meanings.sent1: Facing multiple deadlines at work felt like being caught in the wringers of time.
meanings.sent2: The final exam was a real test of students' abilities, putting them through the wringers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle work and family responsibilities can sometimes feel like being in the wringers.
meanings.sent4: The intense competition in the market put small businesses through the wringers of survival.
meanings.sent5: The challenging obstacle course put participants through mental and physical wringers.
